title: BS Biology with Specialization in Medical Biology
school: School of Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences

vision_mission.university: Saint Louis University is envisioned as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing locally responsive, globally competitive, and empowered human resources who are creative, competent, socially involved, and imbued with Christian spirit.
vision_mission.school: The School of Nursing, Allied Health and Biological Sciences envisions herself as the seat of excellence in Nursing, Allied Health and Biological Sciences Education that is dynamic and inspired by a Christian way of living, producing globally competitive and value-laden nurses and health-care professionals in service of humanity.

program_educational_objectives: Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of fundamental biological concepts and skills needed in research, teaching, biology-based industries, and further studies (e.g., medicine, graduate programs).
Apply basic mathematical and statistical computations and use appropriate technologies in the analysis of biological data.
Use the latest research developments in the field to contribute to sustainable development goals (SDG 3: Health, SDG 4: Quality Education, SDG 13: Climate Action).
Effectively communicate biological knowledge in oral and written forms using English and Filipino.
Work effectively and independently in multi-disciplinary and multicultural teams.
Promote Filipino historical and cultural heritage through biological research and applications (SDG 11: Sustainable Cities and Communities).
Exhibit professional, social, and ethical responsibility, especially in practicing intellectual property rights.
Participate in the conservation and sustainability of natural resources.
Practice Christian values in personal and professional endeavors as Louisians in the service of the CICM mission.
program_learning_outcomes: Uphold the dignity of all life forms exemplifying Christian values in the practice of their profession.
Apply research methods and techniques using native resources to address environmental, health, and socio-economic issues.
Exhibit the fundamental knowledge and skills for biology-related careers, postgraduate studies, and medical school.
Participate actively in community activities with commitment, dedication, and concern for others.

freshmen: Must pass the SLU College Entrance Examination (SLU-CEE).
SLU-CEE is conducted from mid-October to mid-December.
transferees: If qualified, will proceed to Personality Test and Interview.
Foreign transferees must also pass the English Proficiency Test (EPT).
foreign_students: Must apply at least 6 months before the start of the term.
Must be in Baguio City 4 weeks before classes begin.
Required to take the EPT, SLU-CEE/QE, and Personality Test.
Must possess English proficiency and a valid Student Visa.
Undergo pre-admission processing via Student Affairs Office.

tuition_fees.note: Fees listed are per semester and subject to change without prior notice.
